ARABIC: وَلَمَّا تَوَجَّهَ تِلْقَآءَ مَدْيَنَ قَالَ عَسَىٰ رَبِّىٓ أَن يَهْدِيَنِى سَوَآءَ ٱلسَّبِيلِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: When he turned his face in the direction of Madyan, he said. 'Hopefully my Lord will guide me to the right way.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Then as he turned his face to Midian, he said: "Maybe my Lord will show me the right way."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: When (after his departure from Egypt) Moses headed towards Midian, he said: "I hope my Lord will show me the right Path."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: When he started his journey to Midian he said, "Perhaps my Lord will show me the right path."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And when he turned his attention towards Madyan he said, “It is likely that my Lord will show me the right path.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And when he went towards Madyan, he said: "It may be that my Lord guides me to the right way."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And when he turned his face towards Madyan, he said: Maybe my Lord will guide me in the right path.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And when he turned his face towards Midian he said, 'It may be that my Lord will guide me
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And when he turned his face toward Midian, he said: Peradventure my Lord will guide me in the right road.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: When he made his way towards Midian, he said, "I am sure, my Lord will guide me to the right way."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And when he betook himself toward Madyan, he said: belike my Lord will guide me even way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And when he turned his face toward Midian, he said, ‘Maybe my Lord will show me the right way.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Then, when he turned his face towards (the land of) Madyan, he said: "I do hope that my Lord will show me the smooth and straight Path."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And when he went towards (the land of) Madyan (Midian) he said: "It may be that my Lord guides me to the Right Way."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And when he turned his face towards Midian, he said: 'It may be that my Lord will guide me on the right way'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: As he headed towards Median, he said, “Perhaps my Lord will guide me to the right way.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And when he directed himself toward Madyan, he said, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me to the sound way."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [28:22] And when he turned his face towards Midian, in the direction thereof — and this [Midian] was the town of [the prophet] Shu‘ayb, eight day’s journeying from Egypt, [so] named after Midian son of Abraham; he [Moses] did not know the route to it — he said, ‘Perhaps my Lord will show me the right way’, that is to say, which route to follow, in other words, the simplest route to it. God thus sent forth to him an angel with a goat, which he [Moses] set off following towards it [the town].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And when he turned his face towards Midian) he was afraid to miss the way, (he said: Peradventure my Lord will guide me in the right road) leading to Midian.
